meanings.definition: To consider or judge something in a particular way.
meanings.sent1: She was deeming the painting beautiful.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was deeming the test difficult.
meanings.sent3: He couldn't help deeming the situation ironic.
meanings.sent4: The detective was deeming the suspect guilty.
meanings.sent5: The chef was deeming the dish a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To regard or think of something in a specified way.
meanings.sent1: They were deeming the movie entertaining.
meanings.sent2: I was deeming the book interesting.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be deeming the toy fascinating.
meanings.sent4: The child was deeming the playground a magical place.
meanings.sent5: The scientist was deeming the discovery groundbreaking.
